doc:
Francis X. Bushman https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Francis_X._Bushman 0 Francis Xavier Bushman (January 10, 1883 – August 23, 1966) was an American film actor and director. His career as a matinee idol started in 1911 in the silent film His Friend's Wife. He gained a large female following and was one of the biggest stars of the 1910s and early 1920s. Bushman, like many of his contemporaries, broke into the moving picture business via the stage. He was performing at Broncho Billy Anderson's Essanay Studios in Chicago, Illinois, where he was first noticed for his muscular, sculpted frame. He appeared in nearly 200 feature film roles—more than 175 films before 1920, and 17 in his screen debut year of 1911 alone. He also worked for the Vitagraph studio before signing with Metro in 1915. Francis_Xavier_Bushman ( January_10_,_1883 – August_23_,_1966 ) was an_American_film_actor_and_director . His_career as a_matinee_idol started in 1911 in the_silent_film His_Friend 's_Wife . He gained a_large_female_following and was one of the_biggest_stars of the_1910s and early_1920s . Bushman , like many of his_contemporaries , broke into the_moving_picture_business via the_stage . He was_performing at Broncho_Billy_Anderson 's_Essanay_Studios in Chicago , Illinois , where he was first_noticed for his_muscular_,_sculpted_frame . He appeared in nearly_200_feature_film_roles — more_than_175_films before 1920 , and 17 in his_screen_debut_year of 1911_alone . He also worked for the_Vitagraph_studio before signing with Metro in 1915 .
